translation.en: Lee's Diner. I got four down. I need two EMS vehicles.
translation.ko: 리 식당, 부상자 넷 구급차 두 대 보내도록

translation.en: What the hell happened here? Somebody run them over?
No, man, it was a fight.
One guy took them all out in like seconds.
[deputy] Turn around, mister. Let me see your hands.
Aggravated assault is a second-degree felony in this state, Mister...
Reacher. First name Jack. No middle name.
once those boys you beat out there are fit to testify.
translation.ko: 때려눕힌 놈들이 말할 상태가 되면 말이지

translation.en: Process him. Get him to County.
Two things are gonna happen in the next 90 seconds.
translation.ko: 90초 안에 두 가지 일이 일어날 거야

translation.en: First, that phone over there is gonna ring.
You're gonna be wearing these cuffs on your way to prison.
translation.ko: 당신들이 이 수갑 차고 감옥 가게 되지

translation.en: Well, that is one magnificent prophecy, Mr. Reacher.
of the 110th C.I.D. Military Police in Alexandria, Virginia.
You and those boys out there made a mistake
operating on land owned by the U.S. Army.
translation.ko: 그런 짓 하다니 큰 실수 한 거야

translation.en: MPs are on their way now.
If it were up to me, I'd just kill you.
It's just gonna keep on ringing.
The guy you didn't count on.
[Turner] This is she. Who am I speaking to?
Well, it's nice to finally speak.
Thanks for tipping us off to that Sheriff.
I wanted to thank you for helping me out of a tight spot.
Isn't that what Army folks do for each other, Major?
Oh, once a Major, always a Major.
It doesn't really matter. I move around a lot.
-So I've heard. -What else have you heard?
Oh, come on. You're a legend around here.
Some folks still wonder why you left.
Let's just say I woke up one morning and the uniform didn't fit.
translation.ko: 하루는... 아침에 눈을 떠보니 군복이 안 맞더군요

translation.en: Uh, there is this big dent in the desk.
And people say you made it with someone's head.
[Turner] You're not in trouble again, are you?
I've heard you have a way of finding it.
[Reacher] Yeah, I was thinking maybe I owe you dinner for what you did.
Oh, well, it took you a while to come to that conclusion.
When are you coming to D.C.?
[stutters] Well, then I won't hold my breath.
I'm deciding whether I'd like you in person.
[Reacher] Which way you leaning? [Turner] On the fence.
Not sure you could handle me.
Major Reacher. Sergeant Leach. We've spoken on the phone.
Yes, sir. I'll take you up.
Just stopping by to see Major Turner.
Major Turner's been relieved of her command.
I spoke with her a few days ago.
I'm assuming her duties until a replacement is assigned.
Something I can help you with?
You know each other from back when you were C.O. here?
I'm sorry to give you the bad news, Major.
[Leach] Sir, I wanted to warn you.

translation.ko: 근데? 입 다물라는 모건 대령님 명령이라

translation.en: Maybe you should warn me now.
Major Turner is an excellent officer, sir.
Has she been assigned an attorney yet?
Ordered not to give out any information about that, sir.
Just curious. Who was your D.I. in boot camp?
Now, say if Sergeant Greene were having legal troubles,
would you be able to recommend an attorney for him?
I'd recommend Colonel Moorcroft over at Fort Dyer
where the high-security prisoners are confined, sir.
You're the assigned counsel for Major Susan Turner.
I'm Jack Reacher, former commander of the 110th.
I was wondering when you were gonna show up.
Major Turner requested under no circumstances
are you to be granted visitation privileges.
-Why would she say that? -Maybe she read your file.
It says here you never paid child support.
Well, a woman named Candace Dutton begs to differ.
She contacted the Army seeking compensation
for her daughter, Samantha Dutton. She's 15 now.
It's a mistake. They usually are.
Mother's got two priors... Prostitution. Possession.
The kid's been in and out of foster care her whole life.

translation.ko: 어떻게 생각해? 위탁 가정요? 불행한 일이죠

translation.en: I don't have a kid. I've never heard of Candace Dutton.
A hard drive containing classified information
The inference being she's selling secrets.
What do you want, a picture of her wearing a burka having drinks with the Taliban?
translation.ko: 탈레반과 술 마시는 사진이라도 있어야 하나?

translation.en: Can't talk to her until tomorrow.
Where'd you get your law degree?
It's possible you were once a good lawyer, Colonel.
is a tired lifer who'll do anything not to endanger his pension.
translation.ko: 전역할 날만 기다리는 퇴물 변호사 같군요

translation.en: Let me know when you remember what that uniform stands for.
How long are we supposed to do this? I'm getting hungry.
[Buzzcut] What do you think he's eating? [passenger] Shut up.
Oh, it's nice. It makes your hands look big.
Put one of these in your face in a minute, you carry on.
translation.ko: 계속 떠벌려봐 한 방 박아줄 테니까

translation.en: Hey. Hey, hey! Where'd he go? I don't know. Maybe went to the pisser.
You're supposed to be watching him.
What do you think I got, eyes in the back of me head?
You a cop? I look like a cop?
You know a lot of narcs?
Well, thanks. I did it myself.
So, you're looking for something weird.
Well, she's not into doing that kind of thing anymore.
If you're looking for my mom, I don't live with her.
Two weeks ago, Major Turner dispatches them to Afghanistan on an investigation.
translation.ko: 2주 전, 터너 소령이 수사차 아프간에 급파했고

translation.en: Two days ago, they're both found dead near Bagram Air Base.
translation.ko: 이틀 전 기지 근처에서 사체로 발견됐어

translation.en: And the next day, Major Turner's thrown in prison.
What do you know about Parasource?
It's a big military contractor. Why?
I don't know how they're involved in all this,
but they've been following me since I got here.
Whoever killed Mirkovich and Cibelli wanted Major Turner isolated.
translation.ko: 그 수사관들을 죽인 자들이 터너 소령도

translation.en: I think they're gonna kill her, too.
What are you talking about? We have no idea if any of these things are connected.
We need to get her out.
And might I reiterate, she does not want you involved.
translation.ko: 그녀는 자네가 끼어드는 걸 원치 않아

translation.en: Do it now. And I'll call you tonight.
[man] People question the value of enhanced interrogation techniques.
translation.ko: 다들 강화된 심문 기법에 회의를 느껴

translation.en: But torture, on the other hand, works very well.
Attorney-client privilege goes back to the earliest days of English Common Law.
translation.ko: 비밀 유지 특권은 영국 관습법 초기부터 있었어

translation.en: It means that Major Turner told you in confidence
a great deal about what she learned from her investigation in Afghanistan.
translation.ko: 아프간 현지 수사에서 알아낸 걸 전부 다 털어놨을 텐데

translation.en: How much did you tell Jack Reacher?
Ten minutes is a very long time,
as you are about to learn.
Colonel Morgan was wondering if you had a few minutes.
You don't remember me, do you?
Nah. You were still C.O. when I got here.
Held back my promotion for six months.
'Cause you were a hard-ass prick who said I jumped to conclusions.
I'm sure I jumped to conclusions.
You're under no obligation to say anything, Major.
Upon leaving yesterday, did you attempt to contact Major Turner?
Did you confront her attorney, Colonel Moorcroft, at Fort Dyer at 1100?
You told me not to say anything.
I said you didn't have to say anything.
Yes, I understand I don't have to say anything.
For the record, you did confront Colonel Moorcroft yesterday.
Can you state your whereabouts last night between 0130 and 0500?
Yes, I understand I don't have to say anything.
Note for the record, the Major has an injury to his hand
Colonel Archibald Moorcroft was beaten to death.
Lieutenant Sullivan. How do you do?
You are hereby charged with the murder of a Judge Advocate General...
As a private citizen, the Army has no jurisdiction. Turn me over to the D.C. police.
You're familiar with Article 10.75 of the Military Code?
An officer with your security clearance remains subject to recall in event of emergency.
translation.ko: 장교 전역자는 비상시 군법의 적용을 받아

translation.en: You agreed to it when you signed your discharge.
Welcome back to the Army, Major.
I'll file for disclosure. They'll turn over whatever evidence they have on you.
[Lieutenant Sullivan] What are you talking about?
They killed her investigators, they killed her lawyer.
[Lieutenant Sullivan] Evidence suggests you killed Major Turner's lawyer.
They're gonna kill her, then they're gonna kill me. For all I know, you're part of it.
translation.ko: 소령과 나도 죽이겠지 자넨 한패일 테고

translation.en: Hey, listen, dickhead. You're the one accused of murder.
You wanna show me a shred of evidence, I'll defend you till kingdom come.
translation.ko: 결백하단 증거를 대요 그럼 끝까지 변호하죠

translation.en: I apologize. I think I have low blood sugar.
-Excuse me? -I didn't eat this morning, feel lightheaded.
Could you get me something from the officers' mess? Sandwich, maybe.
translation.ko: 먹을 것 좀 갖다 주겠나? 샌드위치라도?

translation.en: Ma'am, these men are here to transfer you.
[Turner] I asked you a question. Who are they?
These men are here to kill you.
Last night, in his apartment. And now they're gonna kill you.
Soldier! You know who I am!
I need you to stand down!
You've been relieved of command, ma'am. Turner, no time.
I'm being held here without cause. It is your right to counter...
That soldier was under my command! We don't have time for this.
Get his badge and his papers.
I left explicit orders for you to stay away.
I knew you'd do something like this. Don't make me regret it.
translation.ko: - 이럴 줄 알았거든요 - 후회하게 하지 마

translation.en: Espin? What'd you do to him?
-This is insane. -Does this mean dinner's off?
Prisoner transfer. [Lieutenant Sullivan] Lieutenant Sullivan coming in.
[Turner] His keys! Give me his keys!
What kind of car would my lawyer be driving?
[female MP] Survey the perimeter! [male MP] Secure the service lot!
-[MP 1] Move! Move! Close in! -[MP 2] Let's go!
Stop that truck! Go, go, go, go!
[lead MP] Get them out of that truck!
So now I'm a fugitive from justice. And a traitor to your country, don't forget that.
translation.ko: - 도망자 신세가 됐네요 - 조국 배신한 역적이고

translation.en: Why do I feel like you're enjoying this?
translation.ko: 왜 이 상황을 즐긴단 느낌이 들까요?

translation.en: You have a very interesting way of saying thank you.
Were those men really going to kill me?
X.O. One of our vehicles has been hijacked. L67.
All units. Suspects traveling. MP vehicle L67.
translation.ko: 전 대원, 용의자들이 L67 헌병대 차량을 탔다

translation.en: Primary is Jack Reacher. White. Male. 40s. Considered armed and dangerous.
Secondary is Major Susan Turner. Female. Wearing military fatigues.
translation.ko: 수잔 터너 소령 여성이고 군복 착용

translation.en: [Turner] We need to ditch this car and get into my email.
translation.ko: 차를 버리고 내 이메일에 접속해야 돼요

translation.en: All right, people, let's go, let's go! Where the hell are they?
Specialist, have the State Troopers called back yet?
All right, has anybody heard from the Capitol Police?
Is there still an Internet cafe around here?
[driver] Pennsylvania and North Street. [Turner] Okay. Take us there, please.
I should have gone to Afghanistan myself.
Mirkovich and Cibelli were my responsibility.
The job is about giving orders.
You ever lose anyone on your watch, Reacher?
My men weren't killed by the Taliban.
They were shot, in the back of the head, with slugs from an Army-issued 9 mm.
I'm gonna find out who did it.
What were your guys doing over there? What were they looking for?
Thousands of weapons, decommissioned during the drawdown.
translation.ko: 수천 정의 무기가 비행기에 실린 채

translation.en: You a Nats fan? Yeah, from the beginning.
They arrested me the day after my investigators were killed.
translation.ko: 수사관들이 살해된 다음 날 날 체포했으니

translation.en: With the time difference, they might have filed another report.
translation.ko: 시차 고려하면 다른 보고서 보냈을 테죠

translation.en: They locked me up so I wouldn't see it.
translation.ko: 그걸 못 보게 날 가뒀던 거예요

translation.en: Sir, she's trying to access the system.
[Morgan] It's Morgan. Ready to go to work, soldier?
We've located them. They're at an Internet cafe, Pennsylvania and North Street.
[Turner] Whatever Mirkovich and Cibelli found out got them killed. But by who?
They're gonna triangulate this I.P. address. I know. Just give me a second. Okay?
translation.ko: - 여기 IP 주소 추적하면 - 알아요, 잠깐만

translation.en: -They will know this location. -Let me try one last thing.
[Turner] There's a bus stop on the other side of the park.
We're meeting someone in the back.
translation.ko: - 어서 오세요 - 뒤에 만날 사람이 있어요

translation.en: Sir, I said drop your weapon.
[officer] Sir, drop your weapon! I'm military police.
Sir, I need you to drop your weapon.
Listen, I know what this looks like. [officer] Sir, turn around and let me see your hands!
I'm putting my weapon down. Listen to me.
I'm military police. These two are fugitives of the United States Army.
Place your hands behind your head. Now!
My identification's in my right front pocket. Will you just check it?
You know, I admit to being a little jealous when we talk.
translation.ko: 통화만 할 땐 당신이 무척 부러웠어요

translation.en: Nobody telling you what to do or how to do it.
It's definitely not the Army way.
Let's take a look at that registration.
[Turner] Parasource? You think that guy in the kitchen was one of theirs?
You have no idea. They ran out of medals.
So don't make this a competition.
Sure you can handle him by yourself?
I can handle him just fine.
I spent the rest of our cash.
translation.ko: 가진 돈 다 털어서 이걸 샀어

translation.en: It's time we stopped running and start hunting.
translation.ko: 이젠 도망자가 아닌 사냥꾼이 되는 거지

translation.en: -[telephone ringing] -Morgan. [Reacher] Catch you at a bad time?
I hope you're calling to turn yourselves in.
I don't know your role in this yet, Colonel. I'm guessing money.
I promise you I will find out.
Not even in Major Turner's email?
Why don't we check my field reports?
I will snap the tendon before it breaks the bone. It takes longer to heal.
Mirkovich and Cibelli's field reports. What else you got on here, huh?
translation.ko: 제 수사관들 보고서네요 다른 것들은 뭐죠?

translation.en: But there are ways to get at you, Reacher.
Thanks for all your help, Colonel.
Okay. Mirkovich and Cibelli did file a final report.
The last man they spoke to was a contractor named Daniel Prudhomme.
He oversaw weapons transports. Said he was evasive
This is Sergeant Greene, your old D.I. Remember me?
Sergeant Greene. So good to hear from you.
[Reacher] I'm here with a friend of yours. We need a favor.
There's a military contractor called Parasource.
Think you could ask around, find out what role they played in Bagram?
translation.ko: 아프간에서 한 역할 알아볼 수 있어?

translation.en: I might be able to do that.
Also there's a Parasource employee named Prudhomme. We need his whereabouts.
-Let go of me! Let go! -Hey, hey, hey!
I don't understand. You said you're not a cop.
Just give it to me. I left it in the apartment where you kidnapped me.
translation.ko: - 이리 줘 - 납치될 때 집에 빠뜨렸어요

translation.en: There are people out there who want to hurt you.
Just put your head out the window.
It doesn't open. Hey, when was the last time you had something to eat?
-I don't know. -We need to get her some food.
How long have you been drawing?
Beth and Herb were these two nice old hippies.
You've had a shock. Your body's pumping adrenaline.
Cortisol. They call it fight or flight.
It's gonna take a while to calm down.
I can't eat. I'm pumping adrenaline.
I know a place she'll be safe.
I'm not going to a stupid school. They have a dress code. This is what they wear there.
translation.ko: - 그런 학교엔 안 가요 - 거긴 교복을 입어

translation.en: I know the headmistress. You'll be safe there.
Then you will go where we say and stay until we say it's safe.
translation.ko: 그럼 안전해질 때까지 거기 처박혀 있어

translation.en: You're very intense. You know that?
translation.ko: 본인이 참 뻣뻣한 거 알긴 해요?

translation.en: -What are you doing here? -Reacher has the girl.
translation.ko: - 여긴 왜 왔어? - 리처가 여자앨 데려갔어요

translation.en: You were supposed to take care of that.
You people. You take off the uniform and lose all discipline.
How would I know? When he was here, earlier today.
translation.ko: - 내가 어떻게 알아? - 놈이 여기 왔었잖아요

translation.en: You're watching me now? Who the hell do you think you are?
translation.ko: 날 감시했어? 지금 누구한테 까부는 거야?

translation.en: I don't have to be interrogated by the likes of you.
He came in here with that bitch and threatened me. I gave him nothing.
translation.ko: 그 계집이랑 날 협박했는데 아무 말 안 했어

translation.en: We hired you to clean up this mess.
He touched this phone, didn't he?
That means his prints are on it. Huh?
[Turner] I mean, really, if I had any other choice...
It should only be for a few days.
You know how we feel about you here at Pembroke, Susan.
-It's so nice to see you. -It's good to see you, too...
Show me what you feel. You are not a camera.
translation.ko: 눈에 보이는 게 아니라 느낌을 그려

translation.en: What do you feel about these hands?
Have they held children? Do they carry pain? Why do we draw?
translation.ko: 삶의 고통이 담긴 손일까? 그림을 그리는 이유는?

translation.en: Welcome to Pembroke. Hi, I'm Olivia.
[Olivia] Where'd you go before this? [Samantha] Different places.
[May] Ooh, travel's really good for college applications.
[Olivia] Have you taken the PSATs yet? [May] You need to sign up right away.
[girl] May! Oh, my God, your earrings! Where'd you get them?
Oh, thank you. Actually, my dad brought them back from New York.
Ah! My parents promised me some intense retail therapy when we're in Paris for Christmas.
translation.ko: 난 크리스마스에 파리 가면 쇼핑 왕창할 거야

translation.en: Wow, Paris. You guys have been everywhere.
It's beautiful. I've been three times. Have you ever been?
translation.ko: 세 번 가봤는데 끝내줘 너도 가봤어?

translation.en: -It's great. The Eiffel Tower. -[May] Have you been in it?
[May] You guys are doing a lot of traveling. -It's awesome. -[cell phone buzzes]
I'll probably stick around at home. The usual.
I don't want you to worry.
What are you doing? You said you didn't have a phone.
How many times did you use this? In my life?
It was nothing. Just one person.
-Excuse me. We have to go. Thank you. -It was nothing.
Nance, give me one second. Hey!
Hey, what the hell is going on?
-What's wrong with that? -One, they can trace us.
Some of their boys got into trouble in Afghanistan.
They lost some big government contracts. Word is they're in financial trouble.
translation.ko: 정부 일이 끊겼고 자금 사정이 안 좋대요

translation.en: Why does he get to have a phone?
-This Daniel Prudhomme... -Hold on. You need to be quiet.
The contractor our guys talked to, he lives in New Orleans.
He disappeared right after he was interrogated.
Hitched a ride back home to his wife and kids.
New Orleans is Parasource's home base.
They know he's back and they're looking for him.
Your prints were found on the murder weapon.
We need to find Prudhomme before Parasource gets a hold of him.
"Daddy is so happy with my SATs "and extracurricular activities,
"he's takin' us all to New Orleans."
Unless you want me to shut up.
[woman] If you're seated in an emergency exit row,
please review the responsibilities for emergency exit seating
translation.ko: 비상 탈출에 대한 사항을 숙지해주시기 바랍니다

translation.en: on the back of the safety information card
located in the seat pocket in front of you.
You're kidding. I don't want you puking on me.
So, how long have you been in the Army for?
So, if you give a guy orders, he has to obey.
And if he tries messing with you, you know, like, all kinds of moves, right?
I mean, it's totally cool. I know tons of lesbians.
I thought all lady soldiers are gay.
Well, some are, some aren't. Like out in the real world.
translation.ko: 누군 그렇고, 누군 아니고 사회랑 똑같아

translation.en: You mean no, you don't want to,
or no, he doesn't want to, or no, not yet, you guys haven't really...
All right. I see how it is.
He left before I was born.
Just says he was a big hero and a total asshole.
so if you need to stretch your legs or use the lavatories,
All you contractors go to the same barber?
Oh, he's not feeling well. You might want to use this one.
Took two more of your pieces off the board.
What were you? JSOC? SEAL Team?
Something like that. When'd you get back?
I'm not sure I ever did.
People like us, we can never go back to the world.
translation.ko: 우리 같은 사람들은 세상으로 못 돌아가

translation.en: And the people around us get hurt.
Walk away now and I won't hurt the little girl.
[announcer over PA] Welcome to Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport.
translation.ko: 루이스 암스트롱 뉴올리언스 국제공항에 오신 걸 환영합니다

translation.en: Now, you're gonna tell me what's going on,
or the first chance I get, I'm gonna scream or grab a policeman.
-I found out that some... -Look, you don't...
Some people were stealing from the government.
At this point, the less you know, the better.
Bullshit! I got us the credit card, okay?
We wouldn't have gotten on that plane without it.
Well, why would you think you are?
Because your mother filed a paternity suit with the Army claiming I was.
translation.ko: 네 엄마가 친부 확인 소송을 걸었거든

translation.en: All we have available is a lovely two-bedroom suite, $350 a night. Will that do?
[Turner] Yes. Can I pay in cash?
So, we gonna take a DNA test?
I got to tell you something.
This whole thing is my fault.
I was the one who made her file the paternity thing.
I thought maybe she could get something out of it.
Help her get her life together.
translation.ko: 엄마 새 출발에 도움 될 테니까

translation.en: She's doing better since she got out.
Maybe she could get a little house.
I can see it in your face.
Yes, you are. They think I'm your kid,
translation.ko: 화났잖아요 저들이 날 딸로 아니까 지켜줘야 해서

translation.en: so you have to worry about protecting me.
translation.ko: 저들이 날 딸로 아니까 지켜줘야 해서

translation.en: So I don't want to be here. So you don't want me here. So I should just leave.
translation.ko: 서로가 원치 않으니까 난 그냥 떠날게요

translation.en: I knew you were the romantic type.
So, Reacher, after those phone calls,
what exactly did you think would happen?
I thought a nice dinner, maybe some wine.
As opposed to your seedy motel?
Never underestimate the charm of a seedy motel.
What do you say we look for a seedy motel once I find Prudhomme?
translation.ko: 내가 프루돔을 찾은 후에 그런 모텔에 갈까?

translation.en: Only one of us should go.
No, someone needs to stay here with her.
What, because I'm a woman I should be the babysitter?
translation.ko: 뭐죠? 난 여자니까 애를 봐야 한다?

translation.en: I don't know how to be the babysitter.
[scoffs] You know, I've had to put up with this crap my entire career.
translation.ko: 군 생활 내내 그런 편견에 시달렸어요

translation.en: Forget the dickheads who think that they can paw me,
-it's every male officer... -Hey, hey, excuse me.
...who thinks that he's smarter and tougher...
You've been relieved of command. I am the commanding officer here!
You are a fugitive from military justice. So are you!
Look, I told you people I don't know where he is, okay?
-He's done with all of that. -It's for his own protection.
he needs all the help he can get, that's for damn sure.
Any place there's dope is where.
You can burn it for all I care.
And you didn't think we were watching the wife.
translation.ko: 놈 마누라를 감시 안 할 줄 알았어?

translation.en: So how do you want to do this?
How about one at a time? I get a baseball bat.
If you were gonna kill me, you would have done it by now.
Oh, we're not gonna kill you.
Not until you beg for it.
Turner's gonna call me in two minutes.
If I don't answer, if I don't pick up, if I sound distressed,
translation.ko: 내가 안 받거나 고통스러워하는 소릴 내면

translation.en: And now you're wondering how you're gonna make me talk without tipping her off.
translation.ko: 터너 모르게 내 입을 어떻게 열까 궁리 중이군

translation.en: And you're definitely gonna have to kill me.
I told you people, I don't like being followed.
Killing you isn't gonna be enough, though.
So I'm gonna take back my promise about not hurting the little girl.
she'll be walking home from school
or she'll be out on a date
or hanging out with her friends.
And you won't be there to protect her.
translation.ko: 넌 없을 테니 걜 못 지켜주지

translation.en: Okay, so let's try it again. This time I want you to take the gun
and hold it lower on your chest, okay? You're holding it a bit too high.
Yeah, bring it low. That's right. Now step out and rotate.
Well, trust me, if all you have left is that move, just assume you're dead already.
translation.ko: 그게 최선이라면 넌 이미 죽은 거나 다름없어

translation.en: That was good. Let's try again. We're gonna add
a kick to the balls into it, okay?
Welcome to New Orleans, Captain. I'm Lieutenant Decoudreau.
We're here to help any way we can.
What do you have for me? Guys on the plane were ex-military.
Do we know who they're working for? Claim to be unemployed.
I want their bank records, service records, foreign travel,
translation.ko: 모조리 알아내 은행, 복무, 외국 여행 기록

translation.en: how they like their eggs, their favorite flavor of ice cream. And I want it yesterday.
translation.ko: 계란을 어떻게 먹는지 좋아하는 아이스크림까지 싹 다

translation.en: She didn't know where he was.
But she gave me a photo.
Are you more upset that I treated you like a woman
or that I treated you like a man?
[sighs] I'm upset that I didn't deck you.
I should have been the one to go talk to her. I can handle myself. I would've done better.
translation.ko: 내가 갔어야 했어요 그럼 더 잘했겠죠

translation.en: Is it really so important that you make every decision?
translation.ko: 모든 걸 본인이 결정해야 직성이 풀려?

translation.en: Oh, God, you're such a dick.
What do you think we should do?
-Don't patronize me, okay? -I'm asking your opinion.
Well, we could go to the V.A. Which is the first place Parasource will look.
How about the local MPs then? Who'll arrest us in a heartbeat.
Okay, what is your plan then, Reacher?
See, you don't know what to do.
You're like something feral. You've got their scent in your nose and all you want is blood.
You still don't get it, do you?
They killed my men, took away my job, my life!
translation.ko: 난 부하들을 잃었고 직장, 삶을 빼앗겼어요

translation.en: I don't want them as bad as you, I want them more.
Could you go see if she's up?
We should get some breakfast, figure out our next move.
-What do we do with the kid? -The kid has a name.
translation.ko: - 애는 어쩔 거야? - 걔도 이름 있어요

translation.en: Why are you so tough on her?
The sooner she knows it, the better.
You don't think she knows that already?
Reacher, what if she is yours?
Then I should have been there 15 years ago.
Did she say anything to you?
-I was trying to help. -How were you gonna help, huh?
You guys said Prudhomme's a junkie.
-We never told you... -I heard you guys talking.
Some dude on the street said there's a place in the Ninth Ward where homeless vets hang out.
translation.ko: 노숙자 참전 용사들이 모여드는 곳이 있대요

translation.en: People talk to me. It's a thing.
Do you have any idea how dangerous that was?
I told you I can take care of myself.
Fifteen years old, people are looking for you, okay.
When things get hairy, I just pick out the alpha guy.
And what, he's supposed to protect you? [chuckles] No, I give him shit.
translation.ko: - 널 해치면 어쩌려고? - 그건 걱정 없어요

translation.en: Strong guys don't hurt you. The weak guys do that.
translation.ko: 진짜 힘센 남자는 여자 안 건드려요

translation.en: Strong guys always have little sisters.
I don't know why, that's just how it is.
Please don't ever do that again.
Excuse me, sir. Can you look at this picture, please?
translation.ko: "아편 중독 치유 프로그램" 이 사람 아세요?

translation.en: Well, folks call it the ninth circle of hell. If he's a vet, that's where he's gonna be.
translation.ko: 참전 용사들이 모이는 곳인데 거기 있을 거요

translation.en: [junkie] What do you want with him?
[Reacher] I told you. I want to give him money.
Now, you spoke to two MPs.
No. No, I never heard of them.
Cibelli's wife is pregnant with their first.
translation.ko: 시벨리 아내는 첫 아이를 임신 중이었어

translation.en: Now, you're gonna tell me what happened!
Now, we'll protect you. But you have to tell us all of it.
Parasource was running truck convoys out of Bagram.
We just ran security for the base.
All I had to do was just lie and say all the weapons were all accounted for.
They gave me a shitload of money to keep my mouth shut.
translation.ko: 입 닫는 조건으로 많은 돈을 줬어요

translation.en: We're leaving enough shit over there now to start another war.
Parasource was selling off the weapons instead of bringing them back to the States.
Warlords want to renegotiate. Parasource says no.
Next day, we're driving through those poppy fields.
The whole convoy just gets lit up.
Army had to send in a Search and Rescue.
Three Search and Rescue dudes get wasted on the way.
Two of the dudes I knew, man.
What happened after you gave your statement?
translation.ko: 조사를 받고 난 후 어떻게 됐지?

translation.en: There was this guy. He worked for Parasource.
He told me not to worry, that he'd take care of everything.
Next thing I know, I hear they've been killed.
I hitched a ride back to the States.
I was a dead man if I stayed.
I started shooting up over there.
I figured if I'd just get myself home, you know, I...
More shit on the streets of New Orleans
-The numbers don't add up. -What do you mean?
Why put huge government contracts at risk while selling U.S. Army weapons on the black market?
translation.ko: 미군 무기를 밀매하면서 정부 계약을 위험에 빠뜨린다?

translation.en: Parasource is smarter than that. Yeah, they're smart all right.
What about on our end? Didn't anybody check to see the crates were empty?
translation.ko: 미국 쪽에선 화물이 빈 걸 확인 안 했나?

translation.en: Probably some dumb guy like me.
We need to get inside one of those transports.
Plane leaves Bagram every Friday at 0600 hours.
Rest, refuel, eleven more to get home.
[Lieutenant Decoudreau] And that was without the hot sauce.
Now, you gotta tell me that was worth it, sir.
Hey, hey, where you at, chief?
-Ooh, you know, you one fine muffaletta! -No, no, no.
-No, thank you, ma'am. I'm good. -Wait a minute. Now, don't go depriving a poor girl a taste now.
I have no money. I don't need your services. -Not today, darling. -Okay.
-Well, it's his loss now. -Go on now.
-Do I have my wallet? -Yeah, I think you're good.
All right, I got my wallet.
I have a witness who can exonerate me.
But he has to live first.
Why don't you, uh... Why don't you come in? We'll talk about it.
Will you guarantee his safety? You're not in charge anymore, Major.
Neither are you, apparently. Operatives have been ahead of you this whole time.
Who were those guys on the plane, hmm?
Who tried to kill me in my cell?
Here's a name for you. Parasource.
Here's a couple more names to think about... Baghdad. Basra.
It's not our first rodeo, is it, Captain?
You think I want to be in this position, ma'am? I have a job to do, and I'm gonna do it.
translation.ko: 저도 내키진 않지만 제 임무고 완수해낼 겁니다

translation.en: I'm gonna take a leap of faith that you don't have anything to do with this.
translation.ko: 자넨 이번 일과 관련이 없다고 믿겠어

translation.en: Look on the back of the phone. Come alone and make sure you're not tailed.
translation.ko: 전화기 뒤에 적힌 장소로 와 반드시 혼자서

translation.en: [Lieutenant Decoudreau] Decoudreau to Espin. Decoudreau to Espin.
[Lieutenant Decoudreau] We ID'ed those boys on the plane. Paid by a shell company out of the Cayman Islands.
We traced the bank accounts back to a big military contractor, name of...
translation.ko: 월급을 받는데 계좌를 추적하니 군 하청업체인...

translation.en: Give me everything you can on Parasource, and I mean everything.
Look, I'm en route to pick up a witness.
No, stand ready two minutes out. Wait for my signal.
Reacher knows the game. If he smells heat, he'll bolt.
[Lieutenant Decoudreau] All right, we'll stay two minutes out. What's the address?
Don't kill me. Don't kill me. [stutters] I'm here to help.
-You're the witness? -Yeah. Yes, yeah, I'm the witness.
-You got what you need? -Not good enough.
I suggest you listen to what he has to say.
I like stories. Tell me a story.
[narrator on TV] Now we return to our Halloween marathon.
Is your costume ready for tonight's parade?
I'm a stone killer. That's why I saved you.
Did Prudhomme give you his statement?
Cibelli and Mirkovich were your friends.
They also just tried to kill you.
They've been providing insurgents with weapons.
You're gonna need more proof than the word of a dead junkie.
And you're gonna help us get it.
Here. Put the cuffs on, take us into custody.
Just get us on the tarmac of Parasource in one hour.
I need you to jump to a conclusion here, soldier.
Six months ago, Parasource loses government contracts worth over a billion dollars.
translation.ko: 파라소스는 10억 달러가 넘는 정부 계약을 잃었고

translation.en: They're bleeding cash and the banks want blood.
But now, all of a sudden, they start paying back their creditors.
How much money can they be really making selling weapons on the black market?
translation.ko: 암시장에서 무길 팔면 얼마나 벌 수 있지?

translation.en: An M4 is, what, five grand?
That's nothing compared to government contracts.
translation.ko: 정부 계약에 비하면 새 발의 피야

translation.en: [Espin] So where are they getting the money?
[woman] Guest Services. How may I help you?
Hi, do you have room service?
I'm sorry, I see you paid cash for your room.
I'm afraid we can't provide incidentals without a credit card.
Uh, yeah, just hold on a second.
You do understand that the parade is coming and it may take a while.
translation.ko: 곧 퍼레이드가 시작돼서 시간이 좀 걸려요

translation.en: We got a hit on one of the stolen cards.
I'm gonna have to call this in.
[Reacher] They're unloading the crates. We got to get in there.
Drill is we enforce the law.
-[man yells] -Stand down! I will lay you down, soldier boy!
Put 'em down, boys, put 'em down. Take 'em down.
You in charge of this operation?
I'm General James Harkness. I run this company.
We have probable cause to believe a crime has been committed.
The Major Turner who's wanted by the MPs for espionage?
translation.ko: 스파이 혐의로 헌병대에 수배된 터너 소령?

translation.en: [Turner] These crates are supposed to contain weapons belonging to the United States Army.
translation.ko: 이 상자들에 담겨있어야 할 육군의 무기를

translation.en: In fact, you sold them to insurgents.
Do you know who I am, Major?
You're the man responsible for the deaths of two of my men.
translation.ko: 제 부하 두 명의 살해 배후죠

translation.en: Now, open up those crates before I grab you by your hair plugs
and bitch slap that smug look off of your face.
What does the manifest say is in there?
I said open up that crate!
and place this goddamn woman under arrest.
Sorry, Major, you're gonna need to come with me.
Good evening. I'm looking for a man,
a woman and a little blonde teenager.
I'm so sorry. I don't think I can help you with that type of information.
I'm looking for two adults and a little blonde girl.
translation.ko: 어른 둘이랑 금발 계집을 찾고 있다

translation.en: [FBI agent] We have a 4-star general in custody. And it's at least 500 kilos.
Where are you going? Come back here!
-She's in the street. -How do you know?
Because that's what I would do.
Did you see anything? Searched the whole hotel. We didn't find a trace of her.
Let's finish this. Just you and me.
I'm gonna have some fun with your pretty little girl.
Is that fear I hear in your voice, Jack?
I'm gonna break your arms, I'm gonna break your legs. I'm gonna break your neck.
[man] Hey, you! Get out of there!
I've found a way to hurt you like you've never hurt before.
translation.ko: 지금까지 못 느껴본 고통을 맛보게 해주마

translation.en: -Do you have her? -Chartres Street. Lafitte Hotel.
Shoot me and I let go!
Congratulations, Jack. I really... I don't give a shit.
translation.ko: 축하해, 잭 근데 난 관심 없거든

translation.en: I told you this would happen.
You said this was about you and me.
If I put down the gun, you let her go.
It's okay, Sam. Look at me.
It's okay. It's the only way.
I'm gonna put the gun down now.
-[Samantha] Is he all right? -Yeah, I think so. Reacher, look here.
[Samantha] Dude, you jumped off a building! [Reacher] Yeah, I know.
Did you see how high that was?
Can we possibly have this conversation some other time?
translation.ko: 이런 대화는 나중에 하면 안 될까?

translation.en: You came here looking for one girl and you ended up with another.
translation.ko: 한 여자를 찾아왔다가 다른 여자를 만났으니

translation.en: Let me know how that goes.
Good to see you back, Major.
Sorry. Bus got stuck in traffic.
are you my father or not?
I guess we'll see when your mother gets here.
I tend to remember the women I sleep with.
But who says she'll remember you?
The waitress who's refilled your coffee three times?
translation.ko: 아저씨 커피를 세 번이나 리필한 종업원?

translation.en: Neither of you had any idea who the other was.
-I knew it all along. -[Reacher] No, you didn't.
You can call me when you do.
Yeah, well, you keep that up, because you're really good at it.
